snippet: With power out and walk-in refrigerators warming up in restaurants across Lower Manhattan and into Brooklyn, “we’re basically going to lose all our product,” said Andrew Carmellini.
abstract: With power out and walk-in refrigerators warming up in restaurants across Lower Manhattan and into Brooklyn, “we’re basically going to lose all our product,” said Andrew Carmellini.
lead_paragraph: With power out and walk-in refrigerators warming up in restaurants across Lower Manhattan and into Brooklyn, “we’re basically going to lose all our product,” said Andrew Carmellini, the chef at the Dutch in SoHo and Locanda Verde in TriBeCa.

headline.main: New York Restaurant Industry Takes a Hit
